item.title: Top Iranian military commander killed in Israeli airstrike on a consulate building, Tehran says
item.description: Israeli forces withdraw from Gaza's main hospital; Netanyahu faces mass protests

media:content.media:text: Gaza Palestinians Al-Shifa Hospital
media:content.media:description: Palestinians walk through war torn streets of Gaza City in the area around Al-Shifa hospital, after the Israeli military withdrew on April 1, 2024.

item.title: Major storms expected in much of US threatening snow, floods
item.description: Powerful storms are on the move after a rough weekend out west. Tens of millions from Texas to New England are in the path of heavy rain, damaging winds and possible tornadoes. NBC’s Jesse Kirsch reports and TODAY’s Al Roker tracks the latest forecast.

media:content.media:title: Major storms expected in much of US threatening snow, floods
media:content.media:description: Powerful storms are on the move after a rough weekend out west. Tens of millions from Texas to New England are in the path of heavy rain, damaging winds and possible tornadoes. NBC’s Jesse Kirsch reports and TODAY’s Al Roker tracks the latest forecast.

item.title: Alex Murdaugh sentenced to 40 years in prison for federal financial crimes
item.dc:creator: Juliette Arcodia and Erik Ortiz
item.description: Murdaugh was sentenced in a federal courtroom Monday morning for a string of financial crimes in which he duped his legal clients out of millions of dollars.

media:content.media:text: Alex Murdaugh stands during his trial for murder at the Colleton County Courthouse
media:content.media:description: Alex Murdaugh stands during his trial for murder at the Colleton County Courthouse in Walterboro, S.C., on Feb. 23, 2023.

item.title: Trans Americans say they found joy and community in some of the most conservative states
item.dc:creator: Sandy West
item.description: Three trans Americans detail how they found joy and community in some of the country’s most conservative states.

media:content.media:text: Oliver Beckett sings during choir rehearsal
media:content.media:description: Oliver Beckett sings during choir rehearsal at Woodland Christian Church in Lexington, Ky., on March 28, 2024.

media:content.media:text: Oliver Bertasio sits for a portrait in his bedroom
media:content.media:description: Oliver Bertasio in his bedroom at his home in Lexington, Kentucky, on March 28.

media:content.media:text: Members of the choir sing during rehearsal
media:content.media:description: Members of the choir sing during rehearsal at Woodland Christian Church in Lexington, Kentucky, on March 28.

media:content.media:text: Samantha Rosenthal.
media:content.media:description: Samantha Rosenthal said there’s “a rich, vibrant queer world” in many Southern cities.

media:content.media:text: Adrian Whittamore peeks beyond a doorway next to a wall with the pride flag
media:content.media:description: Oliver Bertasio speaks with his boyfriend, Adrian Whittamore, at their home in Lexington, Kentucky, on March 28.

media:content.media:text: Basil Vaughn Soper.
media:content.media:description: Basil Vaughn Soper, 37, at his home in Asheville, N.C.

media:content.media:text: A photograph of Oliver Bertasio and his boyfriend, Adrian Whittamore, is seen in a family album
media:content.media:description: A photograph of Oliver Bertasio and his boyfriend, Adrian Whittamore, in a family album at their home in Lexington, Kentucky, on March 28.

media:content.media:text: Oliver Bertasio sings at a karaoke bar
media:content.media:description: Oliver Bertasio sings karaoke following choir rehearsal at Yesterdays Karaoke Bar in Lexington, Kentucky, on March 28.

item.title: Kansas City Chiefs' Rashee Rice reportedly sought after speeding luxury cars cause crash
item.dc:creator: Doha Madani and Elisha Fieldstadt and Chris Young and Priscilla Thompson
item.description: Dallas police are reportedly looking to speak with Kansas City Chiefs wide receiver Rashee Rice after two luxury cars were involved in a high-speed crash and the occupants of the vehicles walked away from the scene.

media:content.media:text: Rashee Rice of the Kansas City Chiefs warms up before Super Bowl LVIII
media:content.media:description: Rashee Rice of the Kansas City Chiefs warms up before Super Bowl LVIII at Allegiant Stadium in Las Vegas on Feb. 11, 2024.

item.title: Winners of national penmanship contest crowned as handwriting is 'having a moment'
item.dc:creator: Mary Pflum
item.description: Nine students won this year's national handwriting contest. A growing number of states are requiring cursive instruction, and research supports the benefits of writing on paper.

item.title: Trump Media auditor warns that losses threaten the company's ability to stay in business
item.dc:creator: Rob Wile
item.description: An auditor has raised doubts about the ability of Donald Trump's publicly traded company to stay in business, according to a new regulatory filing.

media:content.media:text: Donald Trump
media:content.media:description: Donald Trump arrives at 40 Wall St. following his court hearing in New York City on March 25.

item.title: Michigan, the last state to still prohibit surrogacy contracts, ends its ban
item.dc:creator: Ali Vitali and Alex Rhoades
item.description: Until Monday, Michigan was the only U.S. state that prohibited compensated surrogacy and surrogacy contracts. A new package of laws does away with the ban.

media:content.media:text: Leah, Alex and dad a day after Bear was born.
media:content.media:description: Alex Kamer and her husband, Allan Kamer, in the hospital with their friend Leah Zeintek, who was their surrogate and gave birth to their younger son in June.

media:content.media:text: The Kamers with their new baby.
media:content.media:description: The Kamers with their new baby.

media:content.media:text: Alex Kamer's older son touches the pregnant belly of Zeintek, who served as the surrogate for the new baby.
media:content.media:description: Alex Kamer's older son touches the pregnant belly of Zeintek, who served as the surrogate for the new baby.

item.title: The world's oldest royal family dips a toe into social media's perilous waters to win young hearts
item.dc:creator: Mithil Aggarwal and Arata Yamamoto and The Associated Press
item.description: Japan's royal family joined social media on Monday, launching an Instagram account in a bid to appeal to the country's youth with photos of Emperor Naruhito and family.

media:content.media:text: Japan's Princess Aiko Greets Media Upon Her Coming-of-age
media:content.media:description: Japan's Princess Aiko greets the press on the occasion of her coming-of-age at the Imperial Palace in Tokyo in 2021.

media:content.media:text: Japan’s Imperial Family made an Instagram debut on Monday, with images of Emperor Naruhito and Empress Masako capturing moments of their official duties, an effort to shake off their cloistered image and reach out to the younger generations.
media:content.media:description: The Instagram page of Japan's Imperial Household, displayed on a cellphone in Tokyo on Monday.

media:content.media:text: Japanese Emperor Naruhito and Royal Family greet public on Emperor's 64th birthday celebrations
media:content.media:description: Emperor Naruhito and his family largely rely on older generations for support after the abdication of his popular father.

item.title: White House holds press briefing
item.description: Watch live coverage as White House Press Secretary Karine Jean-Pierre holds a press briefing.

media:content.media:title: White House holds press briefing
media:content.media:description: Watch live coverage as White House Press Secretary Karine Jean-Pierre holds a press briefing.

item.title: A Brazilian rising political star's killing was a mystery until an explosive federal report
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.description: Explosive revelations in a 500-page Federal Police report allege ties between federal state civil police chief Rivaldo Barbosa and organized crime in the killing of Councilwoman Marielle Franco, a rising political star and Black LGBTQ woman.

media:content.media:text: People carry posters with images of slain Brazilian councilwoman Marielle Franco
media:content.media:description: People carry posters with images of slain Brazilian councilwoman Marielle Franco during a demonstration against racism, in Lisbon, Portugal, on Feb. 24.

media:content.media:text: Then-Rio de Janeiro Councilwoman Marielle Franco smiles for a photo
media:content.media:description: Then-Rio de Janeiro Councilwoman Marielle Franco in Cinelandia square in Brazil in 2018.

media:content.media:text: Rivaldo Barbosa is escorted by a federal police officer
media:content.media:description: Then-head of the Rio Civil Police, Rivaldo Barbosa, is escorted by a federal police officer upon arrival at the Federal Police headquarters in Rio de Janeiro on March 24.

item.title: Shakira's sons hated 'Barbie' because it was ‘emasculating,' she says
item.dc:creator: Variety
item.description: Shakira graces the cover of Allure magazine and holds nothing back when asked about her thoughts on “Barbie,” the Greta Gerwig-directed blockbuster that topped the 2023 box office with $1.4 billion worldwide and earned eight Oscar nominations, including best picture.

media:content.media:text: Ryan Gosling and Margot Robbie in "Barbie".
media:content.media:description: Ryan Gosling and Margot Robbie in "Barbie."

item.title: Google to destroy browsing data to settle consumer privacy lawsuit
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.description: Google agreed to destroy billions of data records to settle a lawsuit claiming it secretly tracked the internet use of people who thought they were browsing privately.

media:content.media:text: The Google office in New York.
media:content.media:description: The Google office in New York.

item.title: Tornadoes and snow possible as spring storm system moves across the U.S.
item.dc:creator: Elisha Fieldstadt and Erin McGarry and The Associated Press
item.description: Tornadoes, heavy rain, strong winds and snow are in the forecast this week as a spring storm system makes its way across a large portion of the U.S.

media:content.media:text: Strong spring storm system marches across large stretch of U.S.
media:content.media:description: A large weather system moves across the southern United States, early on April 1, 2024.

item.title: Gunman at large after Easter brunch shooting leaves 1 dead and several injured in Nashville
item.dc:creator: Mirna Alsharif
item.description: A search is underway for a man accused of opening fire during an Easter brunch at a Nashville restaurant on Sunday, killing one person and injuring several others.

media:content.media:text: Police tape around shooting scene at Roasted restaurant
media:content.media:description: One man was killed and several were injured in a shooting at Roasted restaurant in Nashville on Sunday.

item.title: A biased test kept thousands of Black people off the transplant list — it’s finally changing
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.description: Thousands of Black kidney patients who were wrongly placed low on the priority list for an organ transplant because of a biased test are now being credited for the lost time, moving them up the list.

media:content.media:text: Jazmin Evans meets with a doctor at Jefferson Health in Philadelphia
media:content.media:description: Jazmin Evans meets with a doctor at Jefferson Health in Philadelphia on Feb. 16, 2024.

item.title: A Latina Harvard grad advised women to marry older men. The internet had thoughts.
item.dc:creator: Raul A. Reyes
item.description: Writer and editor Grazie Sophia Christie, 27, wrote an essay for New York Magazine's The Cut column extolling the virtues of marrying an older man, but the internet buzz is that her essay is more about marrying a wealthy man; she married someone ten years older whom she met at 20.

media:content.media:text: The bride and groom hold hands.

item.title: Ex-Taiwanese President Ma visits China to help build social and cultural links
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.description: Former Taiwanese President Ma Ying-jeou is visiting China to help build social and cultural links on a trip that might include a meeting with Chinese leader Xi Jinping despite heightened tensions.

media:content.media:text: Ma Ying-jeou in Singapore on Oct. 5, 2023.
media:content.media:description: Ma Ying-jeou in 2023.

item.title: Trump camp and White House clash over Biden's recognition of 'Transgender Day of Visibility'
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.description: President Joe Biden is facing criticism from Donald Trump’s campaign and religious conservatives for proclaiming March 31 — which corresponds with Easter Sunday this year — as “Transgender Day of Visibility.”

media:content.media:text: Former President Trump Speaks To The Media After Court Appearance In Hush Money Case

item.title: Former U.S. Rep. William Delahunt of Massachusetts has died at age 82
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description: Former Rep. William D. Delahunt, D-Mass., who helped pass former President Barack Obama’s legislative agenda, has died following a long-term illness, his family announced.

media:content.media:text: Former US Rep. William Delahunt of Massachusetts has died at age 82
media:content.media:description: Former Rep. William Delahunt, who helped pass Barack Obama's legislative agenda, passed away over the weekend.
